class.name: CobbAPIObjectReference
class.blurb: Functions for working with ObjectReferences in general.

method.name: BaseHasWhichKeyword
method.blurb: Checks if the reference's base form has any of a list of keywords, and returns the index of the first keyword it has. If the reference doesn't have any of the keywords in the list, returns -1.

method.name: BaseHasWhichKeywordName
method.blurb: Checks if the reference's base form has any of a list of keywords, and returns the index of the first keyword it has. If the reference doesn't have any of the keywords in the list, returns -1.

method.name: GetActivateParents
method.blurb: Returns an array of a reference's activate-parents.

method.name: GetBounds
method.blurb: Returns the OBND data (pre-generated by the Creation Kit's "Recalc Bounds" function) in this format: [ iMinX, iMinY, iMinZ, iMaxX, iMaxY, iMaxZ ].

method.name: GetBoundsToHalfwidths
method.blurb: Checks the bounds on a form, and returns the halfwidths needed for a box primitive to fully contain those bounds.

method.name: GetBoundsToHalfwidthOffsets
method.blurb: Checks the bounds on a form, and returns how far off-center they are.

method.name: GetChangeFlags
method.blurb: Returns a reference's changeflags.

example-data.comment: Check whether the "MOVE" changeflag is set.

method.name: GetCoordinates
method.blurb: Returns a reference's position and rotation as an array of six floats.

method.name: GetDestinationLoadDoor
method.blurb: Given a load door, this function returns the other door to which it is linked.

method.name: GetEnableStateChildren
method.blurb: Returns an array of a reference's enable state children.

method.name: GetFurnitureAllMarkerCoordinates

args.arg: If this argument is False, then the returned coordinates are relative to the reference's model origin. If the argument is True, then the returned coordinates are world-relative.

method.blurb: Returns the coordinates of all furniture markers on a Furniture reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference, this function returns the coordinates of all furniture markers as an array of floats, three per marker. The function fails if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

example-data.comment: Get coordinates for the third marker:

method.name: GetFurnitureAllMarkerEntryPoints
method.blurb: Returns the entry points of all markers' entry points on a Furniture reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference, this function returns the entry points of all furniture markers as an array of ints, five per marker. The function fails if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

example-data.comment: Get entry points for the third marker:

method.name: GetFurnitureAllMarkerTypes
method.blurb: Returns the types of all markers' entry points on a Furniture reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference, this function returns an array of the types of all furniture markers on the reference. The function fails if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

method.name: GetFurnitureEnabledMarkers
method.blurb: Returns an array of the enabled furniture marker indices for the reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference, this function returns an array of indices representing furniture markers that are flagged as "enabled" on the reference's base form.
Note also that a furniture marker can be "enabled" yet still have all of its entry points disabled, rendering it unusable. This function still considers those markers "enabled."

method.name: GetFurnitureMarkerCoordinates

args.arg: The index of the furniture marker to check.
If this argument is False, then the returned coordinates are relative to the reference's model origin. If the argument is True, then the returned coordinates are world-relative.

method.blurb: Returns the coordinates of a furniture marker on a Furniture reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference and a furniture marker index, this function returns the marker's coordinates as an array of three floats. The function fails if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

method.name: GetFurnitureMarkerEntryPoints

args.arg: The index of the furniture marker to check.

method.blurb: Returns an array of the entry points for a given furniture marker on a reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference and a furniture marker index, this function returns an array of five ints representing the enabled entry points for that marker: a value of 0 indicates that the entry point is disabled, and 1 indicates that it is enabled. The function fails if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

method.name: GetFurnitureMarkerType

args.arg: The index of the furniture marker to check.

method.blurb: Returns the type of a furniture marker on a Furniture reference.

description.p: Given a Furniture reference and a furniture marker index, this function returns the marker's type. The function fails if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

method.name: GetHeadingOffsetPosition
method.blurb: Given a reference and the player's yaw angle, this function returns the position to which the player would have to be moved in order to be looking directly at the reference from a comfortable distance.

method.name: GetMotionType
method.blurb: This function scans a reference's loaded 3D and returns its motion type. If the reference has no 3D or no collision, the function returns 0. If the reference has multiple rigid bodies with differing motion types, the function returns -1.

method.name: GetPosition
method.blurb: Returns a reference's position as an array of three floats.

method.name: GetRotation
method.blurb: Returns a reference's rotation as an array of three floats.

method.name: GetTeleportMarkerCoordinates
method.blurb: Returns, as an array of six floats, the position and rotation of the reference's far teleport marker.

method.name: HasLocalCollision
method.blurb: Returns True if any bhkCollisionObject in the reference's loaded 3D has the "Set Local" flag set. The function fails and logs an error if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

method.name: HasNiControllerManager
method.blurb: Returns True if the reference's loaded 3D has a NiControllerManager. The function fails and logs an error if the reference's 3D isn't loaded.

method.name: IsCleanlyMovable
method.blurb: Returns True if the reference can be moved "cleanly," or False if the reference's moves will bleed across playthroughs when the player loads a save file.

method.name: IsLoadDoor
method.blurb: Returns True if the reference is a load door, or False otherwise.

method.name: IsMarker
method.blurb: Returns True if the reference's base form has the "is marker" flag set.

method.name: IsTeleportMarkerInAttachedCell

args.arg: If you happen to already have a Papyrus variable pointing to the subject's destination door, you can pass that variable as a micro-optimization.

method.blurb: Returns True if the reference is a load door and its near teleport marker is in an attached cell.

method.name: MakeCollisionPrimitiveBox

args.arg: The reference to add a collision primitive to.
The collision layer of the primitive.
An array of three floats representing the halfwidths of the primitive.

method.blurb: Adds a collision primitive to a reference, but does not update its 3D to actually generate collision geometry.

description.p: This function attaches "collision primitive" data to a reference; this data consists of a collision layer and the primitive's three halfwidths. This function does not actually update the reference's 3D and will therefore not produce any further changes on its own.
This function will only work if the reference's base form is an Activator, and if that Activator has a keyword with the (injected) form ID 0x00C0BB03.
This function returns 0 if it fails, or 1 if it succeeds.

example-data.comment: Add a NAVCUT primitive to a reference.

The precise timing for when the game actually generates collision from a primitive remains unknown. The approach used in Cobb Positioner is to disable the reference, re-enable it, wait for its 3D to load, and then move it to itself.
example-data.raw: kMyRef.Disable() kMyRef.Enable() If !kMyRef.Is3DLoaded() ; ; Give the reference's 3D some time to (re)load. ; Int iWait = 0 While iWait < 5 Utility.Wait(0.2) iWait += 1; EndWhile EndIf kMyRef.MoveTo(kMyRef)

method.name: MarkChanged

args.arg: A bitmask representing the flags to set.

method.blurb: Directly sets changeflags on the reference.

description.p: This function directly tampers with a reference's "changeflags," indicating what data gets written to the player's next savegame. The function is intended for advanced use only.

example-data.comment: Force the game to save the reference's "MOVE" and "HAVOK_MOVE" data.

method.name: MoveTeleportMarkerToEditorLocOffset
method.blurb: Take the offset from the near teleport marker's coordinates to the reference's editor location. That offset will be applied to the reference's current location, and the near teleport marker will be moved to the resulting coordinates.

description.p: Given a load door reference, this function behaves as follows: it takes the offset from the near teleport marker's coordinates to the reference's editor location; it applies that offset to the reference's current location; it then moves the near teleport marker to the resulting coordinates.

method.name: Reload3D
method.blurb: Forcibly unloads and reloads a reference's 3D. This function is experimental and may break in yet-to-be-identified cases.

method.name: ResetTeleportMarker
method.blurb: Reset a load door's teleport marker to its original position.

description.p: Given a load door reference, this function returns its far teleport marker to its original position, if it's been moved by functionality elsewhere in CobbAPI.dll or CobbPos.dll. We cannot undo moves by other DLLs.

method.name: Unload3D
method.blurb: Forcibly unloads a reference's 3D.

method.name: UnmarkChanged

args.arg: A bitmask representing the flags to clear.

method.blurb: Directly clears changeflags on the reference.

description.p: This function directly tampers with a reference's "changeflags," indicating what data gets written to the player's next savegame. The function is intended for advanced use only.

example-data.comment: Force the game not to save the reference's "MOVE" and "HAVOK_MOVE" data.
